member.summary: The window for a console UI session.
member.remarks: This window takes control over the console input buffer and the current screen buffer to provide UI functionality. Only one window may be instantiated at a time. Make sure to dispose of any previously instantiated contexts before creating a new one.
member.threadsafety: All public properties and methods are sychronized using the window's .

member.summary: Provides methods to draw on the console.
member.remarks:
This interface represents an abstraction layer for instances to draw on the console screen buffer. It is implemented by the internal class ConsoleGraphics.
An instance of this interface must be provided by IConsoleWindow.GetGraphics to enable controls to draw themselves.

member.name: P:ConControls.Controls.IConsoleWindow.ActiveScreen
member.summary: Gets or sets wether this window is the active console screen buffer. If set to true this window is the active screen. If set to false the original console screen buffer will be activated.
member.remarks:
There seems to be no Windows API method to get the currently active console screen buffer. So this property does not really determine if the window's buffer is currently active. It rather returns the internal flag indicating wether the window instance tried to set its buffer as active console buffer or if it switched back to the original buffer.
If someone changed the active console screen buffer since the last set of ActiveScreen, the return value of this property may be misleading.

member.name: T:ConControls.Controls.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace provides the public console UI control classes

remarks.para:
This namespace contains the central base classes for creating ConControls user interfaces.
These include the main (implementing the interface), the base class for console UI controls and the interface.
It also provides the that can keep the child controls of a .

This namespace also provides the basic console UI controls inherited from .
Currently it is not possible to further inherit these classes or derive custom classes from ConsoleControl. The infrastructure design is not yet reliable enough.

member.name: T:ConControls.WindowsApi.Types.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Provides Windows API types, records and enums.
member.remarks:
This namespace provides types to marshal Win32 API calls, records and enums.
Except for a few types, this namespace is intended for internal use only.
